intro: Ballochia puberula, commonly known as the woolly balloon plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Ballochia puberula is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
